column4: maybe you're suffering from the bug that makes Ubuntu kill hard drives. Tons of people have been affected.
is that true?! uh.. .what is it?
On many people's machines, Ubuntu makes the hard drive go through a load/unload operation a minute, or more, which wears the hard drive down really fast.

you can install smartmontools and see how many loads/unloads your hard drive has gone through versus how many hours your computer has been use to determine whether you're being affected by the hard drive bug.
if that bug is causing you applications to crash, the solution would be to get a new hard drive -- so it's a good idea to use smartmontools and check it out

run this command: sudo smartctl -a /dev/sda | grep Load_Cycle_Count
and tell me what it says
that seems to indicate that your hard drive isn't counting the number of times it's load cycling, or doesn't have load cycling enabled at all
in that case, I don't know how to check as to whether the hard drive bug is affecting you -- but it seems less likely
